name: Commerce
notes: The program requirements in effect at the time the student is admitted to the program must be met in order to fulfill the Degree requirements.
Students interested in combining a BCom degree with an Economics Specialist Program should refer to the appropriate Program of Study for details.
Students are encouraged to take one course towards the Distribution Requirement (see Degree Requirements) in First Year.
During the Fall-Winter session, Commerce students must take ECO204Y5 and ECO209Y5. They will not have access to ECO200Y5 or ECO202Y5.

programs.name: Commerce (BCom)
notes: Prerequisite Courses: ECO100Y5 (63%), MGM101H5 (63%), MGT120H5 (63%), MAT133Y5 (63%)/ (MAT135H5, MAT136H5) (63%)/MAT135Y5 (63%) in a minimum of 4.0 credits.
Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA): Each year the Management Department sets a minimum required CGPA. This will vary from year to year and is based, in part, on supply and demand.
Courses with a grade of CR/NCR will not count as part of the 4.0 credits required for program entry.
The CGPA must meet the cut off in a minimum of 4.0 credits taken at U of T.
The combined CGPA of all courses taken at another institution plus U of T courses must meet the minimum cut off for the year in which you are applying.
